AFA3371H - Honors Evolution of Hip Hop.name: AFA3371H - Honors Evolution of Hip Hop

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Historical analysis of Hip Hop from its African roots to the present with emphasis on the socio-political implications of this phenomenon. With Honors content.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Explore music written and made popular by African Americans and Caribbean artists.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An historical analysis of Hip Hop from its African roots to the present with emphasis on the socio-political implications of this phenomenon.

AFA3955 - Study Abroad in the Caribbean.name: AFA3955 - Study Abroad in the Caribbean

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Interdisciplinary study abroad program focuses on the arts and humanities of African diasporic cultures in the Caribbean.

AFA3102 - Introduction to Africana Studi.name: AFA3102 - Introduction to Africana Studies: A Multidisciplinary Approach

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Key issues and methodologies in Africana Studies featuring presentations by representative faculty from various disciplines.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Interdisciplinary examination of major texts, theories, practices and philosophic foundations in Black intellectual and cultural history.

AFA4242 - Contemporary Issues in African.name: AFA4242 - Contemporary Issues in Africana Studies

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Contemporary topics, emerging crises, shifting trends, and developments in the Africana Diaspora.

AFA4105 - Documenting Africana Heritage.name: AFA4105 - Documenting Africana Heritage and Life

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Principles and research in the process of documenting Africana heritage and life.

AFA3850 - Researching Africana Heritage.name: AFA3850 - Researching Africana Heritage and Life

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Principles and processes of researching contributions of traditional Africana people and communities.

AFA3006 - The African Diaspora: Theories.name: AFA3006 - The African Diaspora: Theories and Movements

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Provides a broad understanding of the cultural, social, and political experiences that define the African Diaspora.
